articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: President Donald Trump said Vladimir Putin had "gone absolutely CRAZY" by unleashing the largest aerial attack of the war on Ukraine and said he was considering more sanctions on Moscow, but he also scolded Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
articles.title: Trump says Putin has 'gone absolutely CRAZY', considering more sanctions on Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran will not accept temporarily suspending uranium enrichment to secure a nuclear deal with U.S., a Foreign Ministry spokesperson said on Monday, adding no date had yet been set for a sixth round of talks with Washington.
articles.title: Iran will not temporarily suspend enrichment to secure nuclear deal with U.S.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 20 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip on Sunday, including a local journalist and a senior rescue service official, local health authorities said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 20 in Gaza, including a journalist and rescue service official

articles.author: Michael Holden, David Ljunggren
articles.description: King Charles flies to Canada on Monday for a highly symbolic visit showing support for the nation that recognises him as its sovereign but is coveted by U.S. President Donald Trump as a 51st U.S. state.
articles.title: King Charles heads to Canada in show of support for realm eyed by Trump

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: The Palestinian delegation won the right to fly their flag at the World Health Organization after a symbolic victory.
articles.title: Palestinians to raise flag at WHO for the first time after vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: It comes a day after the biggest aerial attack of the war so far killed at least 12 people and drew condemnation from President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Russia attacks Ukraine for third night in a row, Ukrainian officials say

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Phuong Nguyen
articles.description: Macron's long-planned trip to Vietnam, the first leg of a larger Southeast Asian tour including Indonesia and Singapore, comes on the heels of Trump's threats to impose 50% duties on EU goods.
articles.title: France, Vietnam sign Airbus, satellite deals as Macron visits Hanoi

articles.author: Kate Abnett
articles.description: The European Union is facing further pressure from member countries to delay and weaken its upcoming law to restrict deforestation, with 11 governments demanding changes, a document seen by Reuters showed.
articles.title: Eleven countries demand EU weakens deforestation law further, document shows

articles.author: Jun Yong, Greg Torode
articles.description: Uncertainties over the Trump administration's security policies in Asia and Europe, the protracted war in Ukraine as well as fresh India-Pakistan tensions are likely to dominate Asia's leading defence meeting in Singapore later this week.
articles.title: Uncertainties over Trump, Ukraine loom large ahead of  Asian defence meeting

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Primary school teachers in Bangladesh joined public sector workers in protests against the interim government on Monday amid growing discontent and political uncertainty in the South Asian country.
articles.title: Protests grip Bangladesh as pressure mounts on Yunus-led government
